DirectoryPath.description: relative or absolute path to a directory

FileName.description: a valid filename, without path, e.g 'main.js', 'app.tsx', etc

FilePath.description: relative or absolute path to a file

FilePathJs.description: relative or absolute path to a javascript (module) file

FilePathJson.description: relative or absolute path to a json file

FilePathRelativeLeadingDot.description: relative path to a file, with leading ./ or .\

debug.description: create both a 'release' and a 'debug' build, whereas the release build is stripped of all logging calls (calls that are defined by the WpwLogger interface)

syncHash.description: replaces the actual sourcemap file content hash in the filename with the corresponding module's content hash

oneOf.description: use webpack 'devtool' configuration export for sourcemaps
recommended for dev builds w/ max performance
recommended for dev builds w/ high quality sourcemaps
recommended for prod builds w/ max performance
recommended for prod builds w/ high quality sourcemaps
Logging level 1 - Errors, warnings, and function start/end
Logging level 3 - Level 2 + non-looping processing detail
Logging level 4 - Level 3 + looping processing detail

WpwModuleName.description: node module package name (with scope if applicable)

WpwModuleNameWithType.description: node module package export type, plus package name (with scope if applicable)

items.description: relative or absolute path to a file or directory

name.description: plugin class name, must be of the form `Wpw[PLUGIN_NAME]Plugin

examples.text: Copyright #{DATE_STAMP_YEAR} [--My Name or Co.--], All RIghts Reserved

defaults.description: copies resource files in directories named 'res' for webapp type projects; and for private repo projects, copies all resources in a base directory named 'res' to the 'res' directory of a '../*-info' public project, if it exists

entryModuleNoHash.description: if entry filenames are hashed, copies the hashed files using a base filename, without the hash.  useful for development debugging / tests

to.description: relative or absolute path to a file or directory

from.description: relative or absolute path to a file or directory

configFile.description: path to a jsdoc json format configuration file, ignored if mode='auto'

debug.description: enables logging of debugging output from the jsdoc module as it runs

verbose.description: enables logging of detailed information from the jsdoc module as it runs

oneOf.description: creates documentation using auto populated jsdoc configuration parameters
creates documentation using specified jsdoc json configuration file

WpwPluginConfigLogHooks.description: hook event logging for increased overview of how webpack stages are executed. enabled by default

ap.description: properties (overrides) to be applied directly to the underlying app-publisher configuration

onCmdLineOnly.description: run release options only when the `--env release` command line flag is set

input.description: input directory(s) and/or file(s) that the build is dependent upon - used in coordination with the webpack compilation's `file dependencies`

output.description: directory or directories where output files from scripts build can be found, or alternatively, the specific output file path(s) - note that this location(s) should be a temp build directory as all output files will be emitted to the 'dist' directory

entry.description: use a virtual file as the entry point, perform build using the types build 'src' path

main.description: relative path to the main entry file, or directory - if a directory is specified, all dts files will be included, i.e. **/*.d.ts

outputAsModuleFolder.description: output with module folder structure as opposed to module namespaces

WpwPluginConfigTypesBundler.description: the library / program / package to use for bundling

oneOf.description: perform 'types' build as s standard module build and a virtual entry point using internal plugin
perform 'types' build as s standard module build and a virtual entry point using internal loader
perform 'types' build using fork-ts-checker-plugin and ts/jsonconfig.json

clean_plugin.description: modification to initialize the existing 'stale' assets at runtime, before first build

dts_bundle.description: modification to fix bug when using **/*.d.ts in dts-bundle's config.main

ts_loader.description: modification that allows use of the 'emitDeclarationsOnly' flag to enable types compilation only, without ts-checker

name.description: for `file` mode, an absolute or relative path to a file, for `event mode`, a build name

interval.description: for `file` mode, # of milliseconds between each check (ignored in `event` mode)

timeout.description: # of milliseconds to wait before failing

camelToDash.$comment: Convert camel case filename to lowercase and inject a dash '-' character preceding each character converted

jsDirectory.$comment: Output all root directory javascript files into a 'js' subdirectory

base.description: path to the base project directory, a full path containing project's package.json

ctx.description: path to the base context directory as defined by Webpack, full path or relative to the project directory containing package.json

dist.description: path to the distribution / output directory, full path or relative to the project directory containing package.json

src.description: path to the base source directory, full path or relative to the project directory containing package.json

temp.description: path to a temporary directory, full path or relative to the project directory containing package.json

WpwSourceJavascriptLoader.description: preferred loader for typescript files, defaults to `babel`

path.description: Path to a [t|s]]sconfig[.*].json file, filename inclusive, absolute or relative to the project base directory

WpwSourceTypescriptLoader.description: preferred loader for typescript files, defaults to `babel`

WpwWebpackEntryImport.description: mapping of module names to respective entry point file, relative to context directory

WebpackConfigOverride.description: An object that is directly applied to the webpack configurqtion before it is returned to the wp engine
